subtitle: According to mainstream history, the human story is quite simple. The first
humans originated in Africa. Some migrated north and settle in Europe and
others trekked east through the deserts over the mountains of Asia across the
Bering Strait and down into the Americas. This is a neat clean linear path to
teach in schools, but what happens when we find evidence that doesn't fit the
mainstream puzzle? With new discoveries in genetic testing we are finding that
the human story is a complex tangled web. The presentation you are about to
witness is from the original Gaia series, ancient civilizations. This episode will
examine the Paracas people of Peru, the Denisovan Giants of Siberia and the
possibility of an advanced ancient civilization on Antarctica. Who were
these ancient beings? Why did they vanish? and what can they tell us about our own
existence? sit back and enjoy this fascinating presentation.
